svg.text: title: "October 19, 2018" date: "2018-10-19"
News and Links
Protocol
* [Eth 2.0] What’s new in Eth 2.0 weekly
[Eth 2.0] What’s new in Eth 2.0 weekly
* [Eth 2.0] Eric Conner’s economics of staking , with Vitalik adding some numbers.
[Eth 2.0] Eric Conner’s economics of staking , with Vitalik adding some numbers.
* [Eth 2.0] Improvements to reduce capital costs of being a Casper validator
[Eth 2.0] Improvements to reduce capital costs of being a Casper validator

Paris slides

Stuff for developers
* Prepare your dapp for optional web3 injection (eip1102)
Prepare your dapp for optional web3 injection (eip1102)
* Ethers.js v4.0 - rewritten in TypeScript; better ENS support, events emitter, event
filters, etc
Ethers.js v4.0 - rewritten in TypeScript; better ENS support, events emitter, event
* EtherLime using ether.js v4 and solc v.0.4.25; 40% code coverage on CLI and 100% on
API
EtherLime using ether.js v4 and solc v.0.4.25; 40% code coverage on CLI and 100% on API
* Buidler - first Ethereum task runner
Buidler - first Ethereum task runner
* Truffle on Azure
Truffle on Azure
* web3x v1.1 - web3js in Typescript. Also, EVM in Typescript
web3x v1.1 - web3js in Typescript. Also, EVM in Typescript
* Poor man’s DecodeABI in Solidity from Austin Griffith
Poor man’s DecodeABI in Solidity from Austin Griffith
* Pixura’s GraphQL API for NFTs
Pixura’s GraphQL API for NFTs
* Multicall - group multiple calls into a single call and aggregate results
Multicall - group multiple calls into a single call and aggregate results
* Connext’s post-mortem on the SpankChain hack , plus Docker images of their hubs
Connext’s post-mortem on the SpankChain hack , plus Docker images of their hubs
* Messaging in Raiden and why they chose Matrix. Also testnet v0.14
Messaging in Raiden and why they chose Matrix. Also testnet v0.14
* Mind Breed - a Brainfuck interpreter where you have to sacrifice a CryptoKitty to add
an instruction
Mind Breed - a Brainfuck interpreter where you have to sacrifice a CryptoKitty to add
* Matryx wrote its code in Yul /Julia to save on gas
Matryx wrote its code in Yul /Julia to save on gas

Preview of Formality language featuring formal proofs from Victor Maia

web3j Gradle plugin for Java, Kotlin and Android devs
* Get server-side rendering benefits without building SSR logic
Get server-side rendering benefits without building SSR logic
* Zeppelin on EVM packages : re-usable, upgradeable, on-chain code. available in
ZeppelinOS and AragonOS
Zeppelin on EVM packages : re-usable, upgradeable, on-chain code. available in
* Slither - Solidity static analysis framework from Trail of Bits

Client releases

coming at Devcon
What EEA & Hyperledger collaboration means for enterprise blockchain. EEA spec 2.0
* Adhara announces Santander’s Julio Faura and Deutsche Bank’s Ed Budd have joined,
plus 15m in ConsenSys funding to work on international payments with central banks
Adhara announces Santander’s Julio Faura and Deutsche Bank’s Ed Budd have joined, plus
15m in ConsenSys funding to work on international payments with central banks
Governance and Standards
* Latest core devs call on Constantinople fork . Per the notes, the fork is pushed to
next year
Latest core devs call on Constantinople fork . Per the notes, the fork is pushed to
* Lane Rettig’s writeup of the Ropsten testnet consensus failure for Constantinople .
Interesting real world stress test, but on a testnet.
Lane Rettig’s writeup of the Ropsten testnet consensus failure for Constantinople .
* Talk of a KEVM client for consensus tests to build on the JelloPaper of the EVM in K
Talk of a KEVM client for consensus tests to build on the JelloPaper of the EVM in K
* AGP1 - vote on Aragon’s governance process on Nov 15
AGP1 - vote on Aragon’s governance process on Nov 15

ERC1497 : Evidence standard

ERC1484 : Digital identity aggregator

ERC1511 : Manager token standard

ERC1505 : Token forwarding

Project Updates
* RocketPool’s plans for its Eth2.0 staking pool
RocketPool’s plans for its Eth2.0 staking pool
* Celer on lessons learned at EthSF testing its Gomoku dapp running on its state
channels . I tried it, very cool. Possibly too addictive, since I’m bad at it.
Celer on lessons learned at EthSF testing its Gomoku dapp running on its state channels
. I tried it, very cool. Possibly too addictive, since I’m bad at it.

CryptoCup’s NFL prediction game is live

MyCrypto v1.4

Ujo officially debuts collectible patronage badges for musicians
* Brave releases new Chromium based version that is 20% faster.
Brave releases new Chromium based version that is 20% faster.
* iExec’s end to end SGX solution
iExec’s end to end SGX solution
* Civil failed to reach its minimum threshold ; says it will do another sale “in weeks”
Civil failed to reach its minimum threshold ; says it will do another sale “in weeks”
* A first look at the Grid+ Lattice hardware wallet
A first look at the Grid+ Lattice hardware wallet
* Maker & POANet launch xDai sidechain. Lots of Tether drama led to lots of stablecoin
fluctuations , but Dai stayed steady.
Maker & POANet launch xDai sidechain. Lots of Tether drama led to lots of stablecoin
* Peepeth is now free
Peepeth is now free

Tokens / Business / Regulation
* John Backus: private bittorrent trackers are loosely a market . Or a protocol token?
John Backus: private bittorrent trackers are loosely a market . Or a protocol token?
* SEC opens a “ fintech hub ” to communicate with their staff.
SEC opens a “ fintech hub ” to communicate with their staff.
* Entire remarks of CFTC Commish Quintenz arguing devs should be liable for their code.
The compliance cost would be devastating and a massive dead weight loss for society.
Entire remarks of CFTC Commish Quintenz arguing devs should be liable for their code.

Worker selection algos for work tokens
General
* The New Yorker on the early days of Ethereum . Solid work. In the same vein, a solid
history of Augur
The New Yorker on the early days of Ethereum . Solid work. In the same vein, a solid

state channel where each transition can be checkpointed/validated on chain”
Zexe : enabling decentralized private computation. “ think of it as a fully private

Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note (new additions in bold ):

If you appreciate this newsletter, thank ConsenSys
This newsletter is made possible by ConsenSys , which is perpetually hiring if you’re
interested.
I own Week In Ethereum. As such, editorial control has always been 100% me. If you’re
unhappy with editorial decisions, feel free to tweet at me.
Shameless self-promotion
Most of what I link to I tweet first: @evan_van_ness
Week in Ethereum News
